para.text: The files describing the RESTful API in accordance with the Swagger specification are represented as JSON objects and conform to the JSON standards. YAML, being a superset of JSON, can be used as well to represent a Swagger specification file.
For example, if a field is said to have an array value, the JSON array representation will be used:

para.text: While the API is described using JSON it does not impose a JSON input/output to the API itself.
All field names in the specification are

The schema exposes two types of fields. Fixed fields, which have a declared name, and Patterned fields, which declare a regex pattern for the field name. Patterned fields can have multiple occurrences as long as each has a unique name.
